edge: Prakash Rathod describes in a voiceover that he is going to retire the following day and goes on to describe the most challenging case he has faced in his career.

node_2: travel bag assumed to contain explosives
edge: The unnamed man carries a travel bag, assumed to contain explosives, in the Chatrapati Shivaji Terminus railway station.

node_1: police station opposite mumbai police headquarters
edge: The unnamed man proceeds to hide the bag in the restroom of a police station opposite the Mumbai Police headquarters.
The unnamed man sets up his base of operations, equipped with SIM cards, mobile phones, and other gadgets, on the rooftop of a building under construction.

The caller describes to Rathod that he has placed five bombs in locations throughout Mumbai and has programmed them to explode simultaneously within four hours unless the Commissioner gives in to his demands and releases four terrorists.

node_2: four terrorists demanded by the caller
edge: Police officers Arif and Jai are deputed to round up the four terrorists demanded by the caller.

node_2: four terrorists demanded by the caller
edge: Police depute a young hacker named Anuj to track the location of the caller.

node_2: most important day of her life
edge: The caller tips off television news reporter Naina Roy, telling her it is going to be 'the most important day of her life.'

node_2: terrorist attacks in major cities in india (specifically the 2006 mumbai train bombings)
edge: The terrorist attacks inspired an anonymous caller to avenge them by planting bombs in an airport.

The anonymous caller demanded the release of the militants from the Aviation Base in exchange for revealing the locations of the bombs. However, the caller turned out to be a common man seeking revenge and left the terrorists to die.
Rathod ordered Arif and Jai to kill Ibrahim Khan in self-defense, but it was revealed that Rathod already knew there were no more bombs in the city.
The anonymous caller and Rathod briefly met during the former's departure, and the latter identified him by his face sketch but chose not to reveal his real name.
